verbs.description: dematerialize (third-person singular simple present dematerializes, present participle dematerializing, simple past and past participle dematerialized) (American spelling, Oxford British English)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause something to disappear by making it immaterial.
(transitive) To remove the physical materials from (a process, etc.).
examples: Even though the book is still a difficult object to dematerialize and the paper books are not replaceable, the trend seems to be to prefer an e-book rather than a physical book  […]
